member.summary: Executes the request and returns a response, authenticating if needed

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestClient.Execute``1(RestSharp.RestRequest)
member.summary: Executes the specified request and deserializes the response content using the appropriate content handler
member.returns: RestResponse[[T]] with deserialized data in Data property

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestRequest.AddFile(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a file to the Files collection to be included with a POST or PUT request (other methods do not support file uploads).
member.param: Full path to file to upload

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestRequest.AddFile(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Adds the bytes to the Files collection with the specified file name
member.param: The file name to use for the uploaded file

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestRequest.AddFile(System.Byte[],System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the bytes to the Files collection with the specified file name and content type
member.param: The file name to use for the uploaded file
The MIME type of the file to upload

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestRequest.AddBody(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Serializes obj to format specified by RequestFormat, but passes xmlNamespace if using the default XmlSerializer
member.param: The XML namespace to use when serializing

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestRequest.AddBody(System.Object)
member.summary: Serializes obj to data format specified by RequestFormat and adds it to the request body.

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestRequest.AddObject(System.Object,System.String[])
member.summary: Calls AddParameter() for all public, readable properties specified in the white list
member.param: The object with properties to add as parameters
The names of the properties to include

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestRequest.AddObject(System.Object)
member.summary: Calls AddParameter() for all public, readable properties of obj
member.param: The object with properties to add as parameters

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestRequest.AddParameter(RestSharp.Parameter)
member.summary: Add the parameter to the request

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestRequest.AddParameter(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a HTTP parameter to the request (QueryString for GET, DELETE, OPTIONS and HEAD; Encoded form for POST and PUT)

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestRequest.AddParameter(System.String,System.Object,RestSharp.ParameterType)
member.summary: Adds a parameter to the request. There are four types of parameters: - GetOrPost: Either a QueryString value or encoded form value based on method - HttpHeader: Adds the name/value pair to the HTTP request's Headers collection - UrlSegment: Inserted into URL if there is a matching url token e.g. {AccountId} - RequestBody: Used by AddBody() (not recommended to use directly)
member.param: The type of parameter to add

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestRequest.IncreaseNumAttempts
member.summary: Internal Method so that RestClient can increase the number of attempts

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.JsonSerializer
member.summary: Serializer to use when writing JSON request bodies. Used if RequestFormat is Json. By default the included JsonSerializer is used (currently using JSON.NET default serialization).

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.XmlSerializer
member.summary: Serializer to use when writing XML request bodies. Used if RequestFormat is Xml. By default the included XmlSerializer is used.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.Parameters
member.summary: Container of all HTTP parameters to be passed with the request. See AddParameter() for explanation of the types of parameters that can be passed

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.Files
member.summary: Container of all the files to be uploaded with the request.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.Method
member.summary: Determines what HTTP method to use for this request. Supported methods: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS Default is GET

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.Resource
member.summary: The Resource URL to make the request against. Tokens are substituted with UrlSegment parameters and match by name. Should not include the scheme or domain. Do not include leading slash. Combined with RestClient.BaseUrl to assemble final URL: {BaseUrl}/{Resource} (BaseUrl is scheme + domain, e.g. http://example.com)

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.RequestFormat
member.summary: Serializer to use when writing XML request bodies. Used if RequestFormat is Xml. By default XmlSerializer is used.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.RootElement
member.summary: Used by the default deserializers to determine where to start deserializing from. Can be used to skip container or root elements that do not have corresponding deserialzation targets.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.DateFormat
member.summary: Used by the default deserializers to explicitly set which date format string to use when parsing dates.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.XmlNamespace
member.summary: Used by XmlDeserializer. If not specified, XmlDeserializer will flatten response by removing namespaces from element names.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.Credentials
member.summary: In general you would not need to set this directly. Used by the NtlmAuthenticator.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.Timeout
member.summary: Timeout in milliseconds to be used for the request. This timeout value overrides a timeout set on the RestClient.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.Attempts
member.summary: How many attempts were made to send this Request?
member.remarks: This Number is incremented each time the RestClient sends the request. Useful when using Asynchronous Execution with Callbacks

member.name: T:RestSharp.NtlmAuthenticator
member.summary: Tries to Authenticate with the credentials of the currently logged in user
